segment.source: Devices Allow undock without having to log on (Windows 10)
segment.target: Devices Allow undock without having to log on (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Devices Allow undock without having to log on security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Devices Allow undock without having to log on security policy setting.

segment.source: Devices: Allow undock without having to log on
segment.target: Devices: Allow undock without having to log on

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Devices: Allow undock without having to log on security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Devices: Allow undock without having to log on security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting enables or disables the ability of a user to remove a portable device from a docking station without logging on.
segment.target: This policy setting enables or disables the ability of a user to remove a portable device from a docking station without logging on.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, users can press a docked portable device's physical eject button to safely undock the device.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, users can press a docked portable device's physical eject button to safely undock the device.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, the user must log on to receive permission to undock the device.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, the user must log on to receive permission to undock the device.

segment.source: Only users who have the Remove Computer from Docking Station privilege can obtain this permission.
segment.target: Only users who have the Remove Computer from Docking Station privilege can obtain this permission.

segment.source: Note: Disabling this policy setting only reduces theft risk for portable devices that cannot be mechanically undocked.
segment.target: Note: Disabling this policy setting only reduces theft risk for portable devices that cannot be mechanically undocked.

segment.source: Devices that can be mechanically undocked can be physically removed by the user whether or not they use the Windows undocking functionality.
segment.target: Devices that can be mechanically undocked can be physically removed by the user whether or not they use the Windows undocking functionality.

segment.source: Enabling this policy setting means that anyone with physical access to a device that has been placed in its docking station can remove the computer and possibly tamper with it.
segment.target: Enabling this policy setting means that anyone with physical access to a device that has been placed in its docking station can remove the computer and possibly tamper with it.

segment.source: For devices that do not have docking stations, this policy setting has no impact.
segment.target: For devices that do not have docking stations, this policy setting has no impact.

segment.source: However, for users with a mobile computer that is normally docked while they are in the office, this policy setting will help lower the risk of equipment theft or a malicious user gaining physical access to these devices
segment.target: However, for users with a mobile computer that is normally docked while they are in the office, this policy setting will help lower the risk of equipment theft or a malicious user gaining physical access to these devices

segment.source: It is advisable to disable the Devices: Allow undock without having to log on policy setting.
segment.target: It is advisable to disable the Devices: Allow undock without having to log on policy setting.

segment.source: Users who have docked their devices will have to log on to the local console before they can undock their systems.
segment.target: Users who have docked their devices will have to log on to the local console before they can undock their systems.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: If this policy setting is enabled, anyone with physical access to portable computers in docking stations could remove them and possibly tamper with them.
segment.target: If this policy setting is enabled, anyone with physical access to portable computers in docking stations could remove them and possibly tamper with them.

segment.source: Disable the Devices: Allow undock without having to log on setting.
segment.target: Disable the Devices: Allow undock without having to log on setting.

segment.source: Users who have docked their device must log on to the local console before they can undock their computers.
segment.target: Users who have docked their device must log on to the local console before they can undock their computers.

segment.source: For devices that do not have docking stations, this policy setting has no impact.
segment.target: For devices that do not have docking stations, this policy setting has no impact.
